channel.title: Berlin 'cannibal' restaurant calls for diners to donate body parts for menu
channel.description:
The online campaign by Flime in Berlin has called for diners to "donate any part of their body" as well as looking for an "open-minded surgeon". However, politicians have condemned the restaurant for being a tasteless PR stunt according to Der Spiegel. So far the location of the restaurant, if there is one, has not been disclosed. "Members" willing to participate in the cannibal "Wari-culture" of the restaurant are asked to fill out a form. It includes questions about medical fitness, Body Mass Index, how often one exercises and even if the donor is pregnant. The restaurant claims to be inspired by the "compassionate cannibalism" of the Brazilian Waricaca tribe. The website explains: "We see feasting as a spiritual act, in which the spirit and strength of the consumed creature is given to the guests." Michael Braun, vice chairman of Berlin's Christian Democrats told Bild newspaper that he had received emails complaining about the restaurant. He said: "I am assuming it is a misguided joke. But it is disgusting. "In particular because a resident of Berlin was murdered by a cannibal not too long ago." It is thought that he was referring to self-styled cannibal Armin Meiwes who was sentenced to life in 2006 after killing and eating a fellow Berliner who volunteered for the task. Bernd Jurgen Brandes, a computer technician, volunteered to be eaten by Meiwes in 2001. The cannibal chopped off Brandes' penis and ate it after cooking it in garlic, salt and pepper. He continued to eat the corpse over the next few months. By the time he was arrested Meiwes had eaten around 44lb of flesh.
Source: http://www.telegraph.co.uk/foodanddrink/foodanddrinknews/7967193/Berlin-cannibal-restaurant-calls-for-diners-to-donate-body-parts-for-menu.html Discuss

item.title: Berlin 'cannibal' restaurant calls for diners to donate body parts for menu
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:48, topic:363266”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=459520.msg3365076#msg3365076 date=1286714629]

We’re the dominant and most powerful species on this planet for a reason. We’re not physically the strongest, we’re not the biggest or we’re not the quickest. We only have one thing.

We’re the smartest. If we evolved with the mindset that some of these animal rights activists this planet would be completely different, and it wouldn’t be us in the position we are in today.
[/quote]That might however have resulted in the world not being a shithole

And us walking everywhere and no electronics etc.[/quote]which wouldn’t be a problem because we wouldn’t know what it is.

item.title: Berlin 'cannibal' restaurant calls for diners to donate body parts for menu
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Frell:

No, Dolphins are equal in intelligence. Theres some key thing they’re missing from us or there would be huge underwater cities where dolphins live.

A wonderful quote from “The Hitchhiker’s Guide to Galaxy”

For instance, on the planet Earth, man had always assumed that he was more intelligent than dolphins because he had achieved so much - the wheel, New York, wars and so on - whilst all the dolphins had ever done was muck about in the water having a good time. But conversely, the dolphins had always believed that they were far more intelligent than man - for precisely the same reasons.

Read full topic

item.title: Berlin 'cannibal' restaurant calls for diners to donate body parts for menu
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:44, topic:363266”][quote author=Thug-life link=topic=459520.msg3364636#msg3364636 date=1286671788]
We’re the dominant and most powerful species on this planet for a reason. We’re not physically the strongest, we’re not the biggest or we’re not the quickest. We only have one thing.

We’re the smartest. If we evolved with the mindset that some of these animal rights activists this planet would be completely different, and it wouldn’t be us in the position we are in today.
[/quote]
I thought Dolphins were smarter than humans? Even if they’re not smarter than humans, they must be damn close to it… Why haven’t they
evolved/adapted/advanced like we have?[/quote]
No, Dolphins are equal in intelligence. Theres some key thing they’re missing from us or there would be huge underwater cities where dolphins live.

While dolphins are very smart, social animals, they are not considered to be smarter than humans because they do not have the reasoning abilities that humans possess. Discover how dolphins are very intelligent and can communicate with each other with information from a dolphin behavioral husbandry and rehabilitation coordinator in this free video on dolphins.

item.title: Berlin 'cannibal' restaurant calls for diners to donate body parts for menu
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Bowser jr:

Yes and we wouldn’t be in that situation that we are today, about the destroy ourself with taking to much from the nature without caring about it being something left for later generations.

Humans are too smart to continue in the direction we’re in. We’ll leave some substantial damage to the planet, but we’ll adapt. But even if we didn’t, human achievements have been far too great for me to say the damage we have done wasn’t worth it. There isn’t any evidence on this planet (that we’ve found) that any other species has progressed and achieved so much.

Worth it.

item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

pkedpker:

Why not have some women thats completely either retarded? or not educated (similar to a cow) to keep giving birth to human livestock so you can harvest it and eat it? I don’t see anything wrong with that I don’t even think thats illegal if you grow it… you are allowed to do whatever you want with it. (Although it’s my opinion, do you guys see anything wrong with that?)

We can take that idea to the extreme in the other way, why should we kill innocent (uneducated) plants and eat them, shouldn’t every lifeforms be threated with the same respect?

We have animals rights, but we need to set the a line for what is OK to at and not eat. The nature and God (If you are one of those who still believe in a Fairytale) have shown us that eating animals is OK. Eating each other is non-civilized because it breaks down the civilization.

item.title: Berlin 'cannibal' restaurant calls for diners to donate body parts for menu
item.dc:creator: @pkedpker pkedpker
item.description:
@pkedpker wrote:

I’d like to say for those who didn’t really realize what those Berliners are doing they are trying to make a point by serving people human meat, because as they said " But nobody poses the question where meat which is consumed daily comes from" so they will attempt to fix that by serving human meat to see if people can tell the difference.

As well as they strongly oppose meat because thats a vegetarian restaurant but they are trying to make a point with all this.

As people are dying and shit from malnutrition although there is enough food on the world to feed everyone twice over daily. As they write

“However, land, water and other resources are used to feed livestock. 1 kg of meat requires upto 16 kg of feed.
Grains used for livestock would be enough to feed all starving people in the world.”.

But yah I don’t know who’s civilized or not but the point is i wouldn’t kill any chicken etc… if those ppl kill chickens.

Why not have some women thats completely either retarded? or not educated (similar to a cow) to keep giving birth to human livestock so you can harvest it and eat it? I don’t see anything wrong with that I don’t even think thats illegal if you grow it… you are allowed to do whatever you want with it. (Although it’s my opinion, do you guys see anything wrong with that?)

Read full topic

[quote=“Speljohan, post:32, topic:363266”][quote author=Frell link=topic=459520.msg3362530#msg3362530 date=1286500499]

He has a point though, however lamely put.

Who decides what is morally wrong and right?

This is right along with the argument of being gay and war. Animals display homosexuality, and animals also fight, and eat each other even if they’re the same species. But our intelligence gives us the ability to reason and fight instinct (in some instances). The majority of the world has reasoned and decided to treat cannibalism as not humane, but you cant always do that with war. In some cases not being reactive at all will hurt more than being reactive and vice versa.
[/quote]I HEARD HOMOSEXUALITY IS A NEW THING AND TOTALLY DIDNT EXIST AMONGST HUMANS THOUSANDS OF YEARS AGO
Btw, the majority of the world reasoned that the earth is flat not too long ago.[/quote]

As to the world thing, its not like they were all in a big conference room picking shapes. The ground it flat, earth must be flat.
